test_case.title: Keynote App Pop-Up Window Content and Functionality from Spotlight Search
pre_condition: The user has any Mac device with macOS 11 (Big Sur), macOS 12 (Monterey), macOS 13 (Ventura), or macOS 14 (Sonoma) and has opened the Keynote app pop-up window from Spotlight Search.
Ensure that if the user has not opened the Keynote app for some time and changes have been made, the pop-up window includes additional information as specified in the steps below.

steps.action: Observe the "What’s New in Keynote" text at the top in black color, displayed in Tahoma font, Regular, size 30 pt.
steps.expected_result: The "What’s New in Keynote" text is displayed as specified.

steps.action: On the left side, observe an icon in blue color for 'New Themes' and Text 'New Themes' in black color. Below it, in grey color, observe a sentence: 'Add a new look to your slides with the Dynamic Color, Minimalist Light, and Minimalist Dark themes.'
steps.expected_result: The 'New Themes' icon, text, and description are displayed correctly.

steps.action: On the left side, observe an icon in blue color for 'Edit Non-Contiguous Text' and Text 'Edit Non-Contiguous Text' in black color. Below it, in grey color, observe a sentence: 'Press and hold Command (⌘) key to make separate text selections.'
steps.expected_result: The 'Edit Non-Contiguous Text' icon, text, and description are displayed correctly.

steps.action: In the middle of the popup window, observe the text: 'Also Recently Added'
steps.expected_result: The 'Also Recently Added' text is displayed as specified.

steps.action: On the left side, observe an icon in blue color for 'Insert and Animate 3D Objects' and text 'Insert and Animate 3D Objects'. Below it, in grey color, observe a sentence: 'Add a new dimension to your presentations with USDZ files.'
steps.expected_result: The 'Insert and Animate 3D Objects' icon, text, and description are displayed correctly.

steps.action: In the middle but below in the pop-up window, observe text in blue color with the hyperlink 'Complete feature list >'
steps.expected_result: The 'Complete feature list' text with the hyperlink is displayed as specified.

steps.action: At the bottom, observe a button: 'Continue' in a blue color box.
steps.expected_result: The 'Continue' button is displayed as specified.

steps.action: In the left corner, observe three buttons: First from the left: a button in red color with an 'x' symbol - indicates closing the pop-up window. Second from the left: a button in yellow color with the '-' symbol - indicates minimizing the pop-up window. Third from the left: a button in grey color (disabled) - indicates the inability to make the pop-up window full screen.
steps.expected_result: The three buttons are displayed correctly, with the red button closing the window, the yellow button minimizing it, and the grey button being disabled.

steps.action: Attempt to click the button with the grey color which is disabled and verify that it cannot be clicked and used to make the pop-up window full screen.
steps.expected_result: The grey button remains disabled and cannot be clicked and used for full-screen functionality.

steps.action: Click the button with the '-' symbol in yellow color and verify that the pop-up window minimizes as expected.
steps.expected_result: The button with the '-' symbol in yellow color is displayed. The pop-up window minimizes upon clicking the '-' button.

steps.action: Click the button with the 'x' symbol in red color and verify that the pop-up window closes as expected.
steps.expected_result: The button with the 'x' symbol in the red color is displayed and the pop-up window closes upon clicking the 'x' button.
